item.title: Stalker 2: How to Get More Ammo
item.description:
The Zone is an unforgiving place and running out of ammo can be a major setback in Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl . Without enough ammo, you’re easy prey for mutants and bandit groups alike. Conserving your existing supply of ammo is key, but some newcomers, even the most resourceful stalkers, can find themselves running low. If you’re not sure where to find more ammo, read on to learn the best ways to keep your ammo reserves stocked and ready in Stalker 2 .

How To Get More Ammo in Stalker 2

There are a few different ways to get ammo, including looting corpses and stashes, breaking ammo boxes, and even trading in Stalker 2 .

Loot Corpses and Unload Enemy Guns

One of the best ways to get ammo is to unload ammo from guns you find, including enemy guns in Stalker 2 . So, when you’re done killing all enemies, you can hover over their guns and hold F on the keyboard to unload them. Alternatively, you can right-click the gun from your inventory and select "Unload" from the menu. This action transfers any ammo loaded in the gun directly into the inventory.

Besides this, you can also loot the enemy corpses to collect any ammo they may have in their inventory. There’s a good chance the fallen have a decent stock of ammo, so don’t forget to loot their inventories when you’re done killing them.

You can also unload guns already in your inventory or those found lying on the ground the same way to get extra ammo when you’re in a clutch.

Loot Stashes

Another reliable way to get more ammo is to loot stashes and check all the safes, boxes, and backpacks you find. Regularly check your map and search for nearby Stashes you can loot. This is a good habit to practice because by doing so, you’ll maintain a healthy supply of ammo.

Break Ammo Boxes

When you’re exploring the Zone, you’ll often come across green breakable boxes . These boxes may contain ammo, but you’ll first need to break them to get the contents inside. You can break ammo boxes with your melee weapon.

Trade

Lastly, you can also buy ammo from traders located in base camps . These traders carry different ammo types, making them a good option when your supplies are running low. However, it’s a good idea to prioritize spending your money on weapon and armor upgrades in Stalker 2 , as ammo can be found while thoroughly exploring the Zone.

item.title: Towers of Aghasba: How To Get Fertilizer
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Fertilizer In Towers of Aghasba
  • How To Use Fertilizer In Towers of Aghasba

Fertilizer is one of the most useful resources in Dreamlit Inc’s Towers of Aghasba, as it increases plant growth. Players who've already set up the ecosystem on the withered Aghasba know how slow it can be to grow trees and crops like Resin Fir, Allei Fern, Big Cap, Barrel Cacti, and Cotton Flower.

These plants provide key ingredients such as Resin, Allei Leaf, Mushroom Cap, Cactus, and Cotton, which are used for building structures, crafting items, and even cooking food. Fertilizer is a great way to cut down the time it takes for these plants to fully grow on the island. This guide will show you how to get Fertilizer in Towers of Aghasba .

How To Get Fertilizer In Towers of Aghasba

To get Fertilizer, you’ll need to craft a Compost Shed in Towers of Aghasba . Here are the items needed to make it:

  • 3 Clay (collect from Clay Mounds)
  • 2 Tree Bark (chop trees, including Dead Slim Tree and Dead Pastu Tree)
  • 5 Thatch (harvest bushes around you)
  • 10 Dung (feed creatures)

Once you have all the materials, press the ‘Tab’ button to open your inventory, navigate to the ‘Build’ section, select the Compost Shed, and hit the ‘Build’ icon. After the Compost Shed is ready, place it on the ground and interact with it using the ‘E’ button. Now, you can make as many Simple Fertilizers as you want from the recipe menu.

The Build section doesn't appear at the start of the game. You’ll need to progress through some introductory quests first to unlock it.

How to Find Ingredients For Fertilizer

After the Simple Fertilizer recipe shows up in the Compost Shed menu, gather these items to make it in Towers of Aghasba :

  • 5 Dung
  • 1 Bone

Dung is creature waste you can collect by feeding nearby animals. While common creatures like Skirtau and Beetlepup are found all over, you’ll spot some new ones near the King Tree. To get Dung, just toss a fruit from your inventory in front of an animal. After it eats, it’ll drop one piece of Dung. Each animal has its own favorite food, so they’ll ignore anything they don’t like. You can use the Shimuscope to check what each creature prefers before feeding them.

Bone is a versatile ingredient used in various crafting recipes. You can grab bones by hunting wild creatures like Fuzzyfin, Skirtau, Spikaroo, Juvor, Beetlepup, and Harelope. Each animal drops one to two bones. Just to quickly mention, killing animals reduces your Amity, the life force that flows in every living being on Aghasba. Amity is also the main currency for opening portals and growing the ecosystem. But sometimes, it’s necessary to lose a bit of it, like in this case.

When all the ingredients are gathered, interact with the Compost Shed by pressing the ‘E’ button , going to the ‘Simple Fertilizer’ option, and clicking the ‘Convert’ icon. It will take almost 10 minutes to prepare. Once done, you’ll receive two bags of Simple Fertilizer.

How To Use Fertilizer In Towers of Aghasba

Fertilizer helps your garden grow faster. To use it, place it on the ground around the area where you've planted new seeds or where you see some sprouts. Simply press the ‘Tab’ button, select the Simple Fertilizer, and click ‘Use’ to take it out, then left-click to settle it. This way, all plants within the Fertilizer’s range will grow bigger or take less time to fully mature.

item.title: Destiny 2 Player Shares Awesome Fox McCloud Setup
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A Destiny 2 player created a Fox McCloud costume using Doki Doki Titan Helm and Bungie 30th Anniversary Ringwalker Plate.
  • The costume showcases Fox's military outfit with Vanguard Nightbeam shader, inspired by Super Smash Bros. Brawl design.

A creative Destiny 2 player has taken advantage of a recent addition to the game's cosmetic selection to reach across time and space to bring Star Fox hero Fox McCloud into the game. Using a series of carefully selected Destiny 2 armor pieces, they recreated the vulpine space pilot in the form of a customized Titan costume.

Over the years, Destiny 2 has cultivated a diverse array of potential motifs for players to adopt as they customize their costumes via the in-game "transmog" system. From high-concept fantasy looks evocative of knights and wizards to streetwear-inspired clothing ensembles, a Destiny 2 Guardian has many choices when it comes to what to wear. Mixing and matching different pieces has given rise to an active community focused on Destiny fashion, coming up with new and creative ways to combine the different options available, and coming up with everything from pop culture references to turning their Destiny 2 Guardian into a walking vegetable.

The latest costume from DestinyFashion Reddit community member Complete-Sun-9960 brings classic Nintendo character Fox McCloud into the fold. Though introduced as the face of the Star Fox franchise, Fox is even more popular as a Smash Bros. mainstay.

Destiny 2 Star Fox Costume Uses Crossover Parts

Complete-Sun-9960's Fox McCloud costume is centered around the recently added Doki Doki Destiny Titan Helm, which is part of the "Doki Doki" line of armor ornaments added alongside Act 2 of Episode: Revenant. The Doki Doki ornaments are inspired by concepts often associated with romantic anime and manga and "magical girl" series. Colored with the Vanguard Nightbeam shader, the animal-like mien of the Doki Doki Destiny Titan Helm looks to all the world like a fox's red-furred face.

The rest of the costume expertly recreates Fox McCloud's military-themed outfit, reflecting his appearance in Super Smash Bros. Brawl . The Ringwalker Plate from the Bungie 30th Anniversary celebration replicates Fox's signature flight jacket, lending the normally bulky Titan class a low-profile look appropriate to a space pilot, accented by a bright red scarf. Fans even praised Complete-Sun-9960's inclusion of a jumpship and Sparrow in the outfit ensemble, with the exotic Colonel's Lament ship substituting for the Arwing, the ship from the original iconic Star Fox titles. Though Fox is better known these days for fighting on foot in the Smash Bros. arena, Star Fox was once seen as a classic space combat series.

The Fox McCloud costume was so impressive that many commenters remarked that they were convinced to exchange their Bright Dust for the Doki Doki Destiny Titan Helm, despite generally being not fond of the pieces. A few also suggested alternative parts to recreate other Fox McCloud design variations, including one with the "metal legs" visible in the original Star Fox character art.

Thanksgiving fun continues in Monopoly GO with the release of a new Turkey Trot tournament. It went live on November 24 and will be available for only 22 hours.

How To Get Points In Turkey Trot Monopoly GO

Fans will need to hit the four Railroad spaces to earn points for Turkey Trot. Here's how much you'll get from Shutdowns and Bank Heists:

Shutdown

  • Blocked: Two Points
  • Successful: Four Points

Bank Heist

  • Small: Four Points
  • Large: Six Points
  • Bankrupt: Eight Points

item.title: Stalker 2: How to Use Bolts
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Use Bolts in Stalker 2
  • How To Get Out Of The Anomalous Field in Stalker 2

While returning Stalker players are likely familiar with Bolts and how they work, those who are new to Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl may find it quite puzzling when they’re suddenly handed a Bolt and are expected to use it. It’s just a small metallic bolt, but it can make all the difference in a life-or-death situation. Bolts function similarly to hand grenades and this guide will show you how to use them to your advantage in Stalker 2.

How To Use Bolts in Stalker 2

Bolts are tactical tools that can be used to detect anomalies. They can be used to reveal their locations and even temporarily disable them. There are different types of anomalies in the Zone. The first ones you’ll come across are the big, bubble-like anomalies surrounding you when Stalker Richter hands you a Bolt for the first time.

To throw a Bolt, simply select one from the Radial Menu (press Tab on your keyboard to open it). Then, click the left mouse button to throw one at the anomaly. Wait for a few seconds for the anomaly to get disabled, and then you can freely move through it.

You can also control the bolt’s throwing distance by holding down the right mouse button. The best part is that you don’t have to worry about running out of Bolts since they are available in infinite quantities by default.

When you want to use a Bolt, it’s equipped in your right hand, meaning you can’t hold a gun or any other weapon in Stalker 2 at that time.

How To Get Out Of The Anomalous Field in Stalker 2

To escape an anomalous field in Stalker 2 , focus on a section of the field’s edge and toss a Bolt in that direction. You can quickly equip Bolts from the bottom of the equipment radial menu. Once the Bolt hits the anomalous field, it will burst, creating a small gap for a few seconds. This short window gives you a chance to quickly get through the area before the anomaly reappears.

Several types of anomalies can be temporarily disabled by throwing Bolts. These include electrical anomalies, acid puddles, and vortexes. Many anomalies are hard to spot at first, especially if you're busy running or fighting. In such cases, pay attention to the beeping sound from your detector, which warns of a nearby anomaly. If you're unsure about its exact location or the reach of its hitbox, throw a Bolt into the area to pinpoint it.
